name: BulkUpdateDatastoreItems
description:
Perform bulk creation or replacement of datastore items.

Use this tool to create or replace multiple items in a Datadog datastore in a single operation by specifying their keys.

parameters.name: datastore_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the datastore where items will be updated or replaced.

value_schema.description: The unique identifier of the datastore to retrieve.

parameters.name: bulk_datastore_items_request
parameters.description: A JSON object containing the configuration and items for bulk insertion or replacement in the datastore. This includes the conflict mode and an array of items to process.

conflict_mode.description: How to handle conflicts when inserting items that already exist in the datastore.

values.description: An array of items to add to the datastore, where each item is a set of key-value pairs representing the item's data. Up to 100 items can be updated in a single request.

attributes.description: Configuration for bulk inserting multiple items into a datastore.

type.description: The resource type for datastore items.

data.description: Data wrapper containing the items to insert and their configuration for the bulk insert operation.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.

parameters.name: datastore_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the datastore to retrieve.

value_schema.description: The unique identifier of the datastore to retrieve.

conflict_mode.description: How to handle conflicts when inserting items that already exist in the datastore.

values.description: An array of items to add to the datastore, where each item is a set of key-value pairs representing the item's data. Up to 100 items can be updated in a single request.

attributes.description: Configuration for bulk inserting multiple items into a datastore.

type.description: The resource type for datastore items.

data.description: Data wrapper containing the items to insert and their configuration for the bulk insert operation.
